channel.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
channel.description:
I came back after a break for a couple of months and I was just surfing the forums and found a lot of things that symbolic the way the community is now.
Honestly people should be in trouble for just putting down someone. 'Kozs, I don't understand what you mean!"
Look at these photos.
[img]http://gyazo.com/103652d8a8295f8c75e0cd3b60daca5e.png[/img]
Not trying to insult anyone, but we really need to think what we post, honestly, if the server fails. And everyone knows it. BUT the server owner is having fun while it lasts. LET IT BE! The meaning of RSPS is to have fun, Age should not be a conflict with RuneScape Priv. Servers

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

runescape sucks:

I’m a bit frusturated when I see newbies asking for help, and the more advanced users here try to explain it in a way they won’t understand.

This too

Read full topic

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

When did anyone here claim to be of great help to any and all problems?

But I can agree that we need to tone it down a bit. Seeing posts like “wowowwowowowo fukin nerd ass niger l2compile b4 u leech dipshit” is kind of disappointing.

Read full topic

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Fails, post:14, topic:470224”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=587622.msg4169698#msg4169698 date=1354133403]
The help section isn’t only for people that don’t know java, you know.
[/quote]
How many threads have you seen that didn’t consist of something simple?

  • How to get my compiler to work
  • How do I make myself owner

Shit like that.[/quote]

I dont know… but I think you’re missing my point… lol.

All I’m saying is it’s annoying, I’ll deal with it though. Not saying we need to stop helping them.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?

the elve age:

I wish this was about our shitty help sections instead -.-

It’s about both.
It’s about all of it.

[/quote]

Shit like that.[/quote]

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule

@asshole_rule wrote:

Fails:

Then the help section would serve no purpose.

The help section isn’t only for people that don’t know java, you know.

item.source: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

asshole_rule:

It gets really tiring and annoying when you have to help somebody, and you explain it then best you can and they still don’t understand.

If you’re easily irritated by others ignorance toward private servers, don’t go toward the help section. It’s as simple as that.

asshole_rule:

Honestly, if you need that much help you shouldn’t be making an rsps. With a couple lessons in java it would be so much easier to help people.

Then the help section would serve no purpose.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Si Force:

I thought you were posting about the ‘Help section’ judging from the title, I didn’t expect a rant about servers… In my opinion, from a brief look at the help section recently, a lot of our members take the “not spoonfeeding members” to heart and then end up giving the user pitiful help. I always hate when I see a member attempting to give another help, then getting angry when the person wanting help does not understand. It’s usually not the users fault, but the helper themselves. That’s my daily rant. :rolleyes:

It gets really tiring and annoying when you have to help somebody, and you explain it then best you can and they still don’t understand.

Honestly, if you need that much help you shouldn’t be making an rsps. With a couple lessons in java it would be so much easier to help people.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

reyx7:

It’s just what we’ve become. You can’t change it because the system still works itself out. There are thousands of people not on these forums who are fine with how servers are right now. Change will come when change is needed. Until then, we must face this, whether you like it or not.

Post of the week.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Ruby:

@Si Force: while there’s people like that it also switches the other way for example, there’s people who are getting help from someone and then get angry at them for not understanding their vague topic title. It’s just something that won’t change in my opinion.

That’s true also, I see that a lot too. It’s not something we can change, just promote more so than we are doing I guess.

Read full topic
item.source: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?

item.title: What kind of "Helping" community are we honestly?
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

Ruby:

@Davidi2:

Except that’s Si Force, not Davidi2.

In all honesty, I don’t even see the point in the help section, simply because no one actually helps. Over half the comments are ‘do it yourself’, ‘we don’t spoonfeed’, and ‘search it on google.’ Members don’t join the community to receive such negative, smart-ass comments. Then again, that’s where the ‘Server Helper’ badge steps in to play.

Read full topic
